com.google.api.ads.dfp.lib.utils.v201108
Class StatementBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.google.api.ads.dfp.lib.utils.v201108.StatementBuilder

public class StatementBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

StatementBuilder allows for statements to be constructed in parts.

Typical usage is: 

 StatementBuilder statementBuilder
     = new StatementBuilder("WHERE id = :id AND type = :type");
 statementBuilder.putValue("id", 1234L).putValue("type", "Type");
 Statement statement = statementBuilder.toStatement();

Author:
api.arogal@gmail.com (Adam Rogal)

putAll

public StatementBuilder putAll(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> values)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a Value for each mapping of key to Object and adds it to the statement builder. If the Object cannot be converted into a Value, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
values - the mappings of key to Object
Returns:
a reference to this object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the entries in the values have values which cannot be converted into a valid Value

createValue

public static Value createValue(java.lang.Object value)
Creates a Value from the value i.e. a TextValue for a value of type String. If the value is a Value, the value is returned. If the value is null, an empty TextValue is returned.

Parameters:
value - the value to convert
Returns:
the constructed value of the appropriate type

toStatement

public Statement toStatement()
Gets the Statement representing the state of this statement builder.

Returns:
the Statement
